[encoder] fic bug in adding ref info to summary encoding

normalization was not handled correctly when adding ref info to pileup encoding.
this commit splits the pileup encoding tensor from the ref info tensor, and
combines them only after the normalization of the pileup counts.

Updated
Updates
Add full CI support- Auto-release & nightly builds

MultiZMW stitching, model structure inputs, log(0) fixes

- MultiZMW stitching: multiple zmws in HDF5. readids in hdf5 delinate
  zmw/window boundaries for correct stitching. Many zmws can be sent
  to GPU for inference with results stitched at end.

- model structure inputs: hardcoded values are now inputs. same
  create_model between training and inference. TODO: should hardcode
  values in python source files and import different models by name
  for continuity

- fixed log(0) in QV values. Softmax can get numeric 1.0 resulting in
  undefined QV.
Addressed review comments
X
Added new focal loss
Conflicts resolved

formatting fix

- added blank lines

Fix logit / probability bug

- converted model softmax logits to probabilities. This now allows
  correct base qualities to be output.

Merge pull request #137 from tijyojwad/jdaw/fix-consensus-inference

[model] add optional softmax layer to consensus rnn

[docs] update install instructions

1. add style dependency requirements to install
2. remove redundant packages from main reqiurements.txt file
[reqs] update requirements and docs
[model] add optional softmax layer to consensus rnn
- formatting fixes

- requirements.txt: updated for "pre-push" tests

- simple_consensus_caller: minimap/2.17 is required. 2.15 fails

- EXAMPLE FAILS: python rnn_consensus_infer.py --infer-hdf infer.hdf --model-dir `pwd`/sample_models -o sample.fasta

  File "rnn_consensus_infer.py", line 101, in <module>
    infer(args)
  File "rnn_consensus_infer.py", line 78, in infer
    fastq_file.write_output("dl_consensus", nucleotides_sequence, nucleotides_certainty)
  File "/home/UNIXHOME/mbrown/mbrown/workspace2020Q3/VariantWorks/VariantWorks/variantworks/io/fastxio.py", line 70, in write_output
    convert_error_probability_arr_to_phred([1 - val for val in record_quality])
  File "/home/UNIXHOME/mbrown/mbrown/workspace2020Q3/VariantWorks/VariantWorks/variantworks/utils/metrics.py", line 25, in convert_error_probability_arr_to_phred
    raise ValueError("all values in error probability array must be between 0 and 1")
   ValueError: all values in error probability array must be between 0 and 1

  - TODO: Bug? All values are negative. Softmaxes vs probablitiies?
    See comments in samples/simple_consensus_caller/rnn_consensus_infer.py
